title: BERA/ESRC 2007 Residential Summer School
abstractText:
The importance of building and maintaining the capacity of the education research community has been well documented, by governmental agencies (such as the Teacher Training Agency and the Department for Education and Skills), by the ESRC (in its recent 2006 Demographic Review of the Social Sciences), and by the education research community itself (ESRC TLRP Research Capacity Building Network). As part of the continuing commitment to increasing educational research capacity, a four day (three night) residential school for education research students will be organised during the summer of 2007 as part of the ESRC Researcher Development Initiative (RDI).

The main objectives of the summer residential school are:

  • To provide research students with high quality research training that will develop their research expertise;
  • To bring together education research students from across the UK to share their postgraduate research with their peers in an informal and supportive environment;
  • To facilitate reflection among research students on the salience of methods and themes raised in workshops and plenary sessions for the development of their own research;
  • To contribute to the ESRC and BERA shared mission of developing research capacity among a new cohort of education researchers.
